Container.Name: Drone-CI-Gitea
Container.Overview: Drone is a Continuous Integration platform built on Docker. In this particular case it is the apptemplate for use with Gitea

Config.Name: DRONE_AGENTS_ENABLED
Config.Description: DRONE_AGENTS_ENABLED as true if you want to run server and agent in the same container.

Config.Name: DRONE_GITEA_CLIENT_ID
Config.Description: You need to generate Client ID in GITEA

Config.Name: DRONE_GITEA_CLIENT_SECRET
Config.Description: You need to generate Client Secret in GITEA

Config.Name: DRONE_RPC_SECRET
Config.Description: Required literal value provides the Drone shared secret. This is used to authenticate the RPC connection to the server. The server and runners must be provided the same secret value.

Config.Name: DRONE_SERVER_PROTO
Config.Description: Required string value configures the user-facing protocol. This value is used to create webhooks and redirect urls. It has no actual impact on serving traffic. Values = http / https

Config.Name: DRONE_GIT_ALWAYS_AUTH
Config.Description: Optional boolean value. Configures Drone to authenticate when cloning public repositories. This is only required when your source code management system (e.g. GitHub Enterprise) has private mode enabled.

Config.Name: DRONE_USER_CREATE
Config.Description: Optional user account that should be created on startup. This should be used to seed the system with an administrative account. It can be a real account (i.e. a real GitHub user) or it can be a machine account.
